entities: United Nations Organization Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo
summary:
The Security Council adopted Resolution 1323 (2000) on 13 October 2000, 
Recalling previous resolutions and statements on the Democratic Republic of the Congo, 
Reaffirming the country's sovereignty, territorial integrity and political independence, 
Deploring continued hostilities, lack of cooperation with the UN and progress on national dialogue, 
Noting the Secretary-General's report and its recommendations, 
Reaffirming readiness to assist in the peace process through MONUC, 
Expressing concern at humanitarian and human rights situations and illegal exploitation of natural resources, 
1. Decides to extend MONUC's mandate until 15 December 2000; 
2. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
